title: Electromagnetism Terms
description: Charge up your vocabulary with the science of electricity and magnetism, from circuits and currents to electromagnetic waves and fields.

questions.question: What is an 'electromagnetic wave'?
options: A sound wave amplified by a speaker
A wave consisting of oscillating electric and magnetic fields that can travel through a vacuum
A water wave created by a magnet

questions.question: What does 'voltage' measure?
options: The power consumed by a device
The electrical potential difference between two points, which drives current through a circuit

questions.question: What is 'current' in electricity?
options: The flow of electric charge through a conductor, measured in amperes

questions.question: What does 'Ohm's Law' describe?
options: The relationship between voltage, current, and resistance: V = IR

questions.question: What is a 'capacitor'?
options: A component that stores electrical energy in an electric field

questions.question: What is 'resistance' in an electrical circuit?
options: The opposition to the flow of electric current, measured in ohms
The brightness of a light bulb

questions.question: What is an 'electromagnet'?
options: A magnet created by passing electric current through a coil of wire

questions.question: What does 'induction' mean in electromagnetism?
options: Connecting a battery to a circuit
The storage of energy in a battery
The generation of an electric current by a changing magnetic field

questions.question: What is a 'conductor'?
options: A material that allows electric current to flow through it easily

questions.question: What is the 'electromagnetic spectrum'?
options: The entire range of electromagnetic radiation, from radio waves to gamma rays
The visible colors of the rainbow only

questions.question: What is a 'transformer'?
options: A motor that converts electricity to motion
A device that changes the voltage of alternating current electricity

questions.question: What does 'alternating current' (AC) mean?
options: Current that flows in one direction only
Electric current that periodically reverses direction

questions.question: What is 'magnetic flux'?
options: The speed at which magnets attract
The color of a magnetic field
A measure of the total magnetic field passing through a given area
The strength of a permanent magnet

questions.question: What is a 'semiconductor'?
options: A material with electrical conductivity between a conductor and an insulator, used in electronics

questions.question: What did 'Faraday's Law' establish?
options: That a changing magnetic field induces an electric current in a conductor
The relationship between force and mass
